intro: Ouratea laevigata, commonly known as the smooth ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
